<error-page>
    <error-code>404</error-code>
<!--    <location>/x404.html</location> -->
    <location>/x404.jsp</location>
  </error-page>

The above does not work when using the <Host> element.  I have a webapp defined 
in <Host> with the above entries in the ROOT context of the <Host>.  If I use 
x404.jsp, the compile is not done and tc throws a class not found exception 
(see below).  If I use the x404.html, tc ignores the error-page and does it's 
own 404 not found error.  If I do *not* use <Host> to contain a <Context...>, 
it works fine.  Please advise.

Note: I've tested the above scenarios in tomcat4.  It all works fine, so I'm 
sure I don't have any syntax or file location problems.

Thanks
Mike
